org.fluidity.foundation.security

Class Security

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.security.Security

  • public final class Security
extends Object
    Security related convenience functions.

    Usage

    Privileged access

     final PrivilegedAction<T> action = …
 final T result = Security.invoke(action);

 try {
     return Security.invoke(SomeCheckedException.class, …);
 } catch (final SomeCheckedException e) {
     …
 }

    Object Accessibility

     final Method method = Security.access(…);

 method.invoke(…);

      Convenience method to safely make some object accessible.

    • Method Detail

      • access

        public static <T extends AccessibleObject> T access(T object)
        Convenience method to safely make some object accessible.

        If the given object is already accessible, this method simply returns it.

        If the object is not accessible, this method makes it so in a PrivilegedAction.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the object's type.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to process.
        Returns:
        a PrivilegedAction or null, as described above.

      • invoke

        public static <T> T invoke(PrivilegedAction<T> action)
        Simply invokes AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction) with action.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of action.
        Parameters:
        action - the privileged action to invoke.
        Returns:
        the result of invoking action.

      • invoke

        public static <T> T invoke(AccessControlContext context,
                           PrivilegedAction<T> action,
                           Permission... permissions)
        Invokes either AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction, AccessControlContext) or AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction, AccessControlContext, Permission...) with action.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of action.
        Parameters:
        context - see AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction, AccessControlContext).
        action - the privileged action to invoke.
        permissions - see AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction, AccessControlContext, Permission...).
        Returns:
        the result of invoking action.

      • invoke

        public static <T,E extends Exception> T invoke(Class<E> error,
                                               PrivilegedExceptionAction<T> action)
                                        throws E extends Exception
        Simply invokes AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction) with action.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of action.
        E - the highest level Exception type that action can throw.
        Parameters:
        error - the highest level Exception class that action can throw.
        action - the privileged action to invoke.
        Returns:
        the result of invoking action.
        Throws:
        E - whatever action.
        E extends Exception

      • invoke

        public static <T,E extends Exception> T invoke(Class<E> error,
                                               AccessControlContext context,
                                               PrivilegedExceptionAction<T> action,
                                               Permission... permissions)
                                        throws E extends Exception
        Invokes either AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction, AccessControlContext) or AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction, AccessControlContext, Permission...) with action.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of action.
        E - the highest level Exception type action can throw.
        Parameters:
        error - the highest level Exception class that action can throw.
        context - see AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction, AccessControlContext).
        action - the privileged action to invoke.
        permissions - see AccessController.doPrivileged(PrivilegedExceptionAction, AccessControlContext, Permission...).
        Returns:
        the result of invoking action.
        Throws:
        E - whatever action.
        E extends Exception
